column1: JINYA Ramen Bar - Houston////I think I heard too much hype about Jinya before I went there.  Don't get me wrong it was good
column2: but not as good as the hype.  If you want a trendy/hip atmosphere for ramen then this is definitely the spot.  The look is very modern with loud dance music...felt very hip which has its place.  I had the seaweed salad and the spicy tonkusu.  The ramen broth was very tasty
column3: but what fell short was the noodles were not as good as other ramen spots that make their noodles fresh.  If the noodles were better
column4: I would have given one more star as I really enjoyed the flavor of the broth.  We had a nice dinner there
column5: and I will go back if in the neighborhood
column6: but I don't think it is the best ramen in town.  We took lyft to get there but parking may be a problem.
